title: Quiz 5: Comprehensive Review
description: A final integration quiz covering all aspects of Unit Four.

questions.question: Match the contraceptive method to its appropriate candidate:

pairs.right: Woman who completed family, low STI risk

questions.explanation: COCs help acne; POPs safe for lactation; IUCD good for long term; Condoms protect against STIs.
questions.hint: Match the benefit/profile to the method.

questions.question: Which methods protect against Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Only barrier methods (condoms) offer significant STI protection. Diaphragms offer minimal protection. Hormonal methods and IUCDs offer NONE.

questions.question: Rank the following methods from Shortest to Longest duration of action (Theoretical):

Review the scenario: A 28-year-old woman, 6 weeks postpartum, fully breastfeeding, amenorrhoeic. She wants a method she can stop easily if she wants another child soon. Which method is MOST appropriate?

richContent.content:
Key Factors:
  • Breastfeeding (No Oestrogen)
  • Reversible (Short term)
  • LAM criteria met

questions.explanation: LAM is valid, but adding POPs provides extra security without affecting milk (unlike COCs). BTL is permanent. IUCD is possible but POPs/LAM fits 'easy to stop' better.

questions.question: The failure rate of vasectomy is approximately ___BLANK___ %.
questions.explanation: Vasectomy is highly effective with a failure rate of roughly 0.3% (usually due to recanalization or unprotected sex too soon).

questions.question: Post-abortion patients can start hormonal contraceptives immediately.
questions.explanation: Ovulation can occur very quickly after abortion (within 2 weeks), so immediate contraception is recommended.

questions.question: What is the acronym for the serious danger signs associated with Combined Oral Contraceptives?
questions.explanation: ACHES: Abdominal pain, Chest pain, Headaches, Eye problems, Severe leg pain.

questions.question: Which hormone is primarily responsible for the temperature rise in BBT?
questions.explanation: Progesterone, released by the corpus luteum after ovulation, is thermogenic and raises BBT.

questions.question: Which of the following are non-contraceptive benefits of Combined Oral Contraceptives?
questions.explanation: COCs reduce bleeding, pain, and cancer risks (ovarian/endometrial) but offer NO STI protection.
questions.hint: Health benefits related to the cycle.

questions.question: Natural Family Planning methods can protect against HIV/AIDS.
questions.explanation: NFP involves tracking fertility and abstinence/barrier use, but the method itself offers ZERO protection against viruses like HIV.
